content:
I’m a senior at Macalester College studying statistics with minors in geography and creative writing. Right now, I’m excited about spatial data, public transit, and creating reproducible research and R resources! This year, I’m working at Metro Transit as a data science intern and participated in the National Gallery of Art’s first annual Innovation Lab. I’ve loved these opportunities to work for my community and explore real, meaningful data!
This year, I’m also working on an honors thesis modeling spatio-temporal transit demand in the Twin Cities. When I’m not busy with statistics, I love rock climbing, poetry, and working on my design and visualization skills!
summary:
I’m a senior at Macalester College studying statistics with minors in geography and creative writing. Right now, I’m excited about spatial data, public transit, and creating reproducible research and R resources! This year, I’m working at Metro Transit as a data science intern and participated in the National Gallery of Art’s first annual Innovation Lab. I’ve loved these opportunities to work for my community and explore real, meaningful data!
This year, I’m also working on an honors thesis modeling spatio-temporal transit demand in the Twin Cities.
title: Raven McKnight

content:
I was recently inspired by Allysa Fowers visualization of her fall semester coffee consumption. I tracked my own coffee-drinking data for a month and created this plot.
It was fun to see where I drank abnormal amounts of coffee, or coffee at abnormal times – like the office hours I hold on Mondays at 7pm or during my trip to DC towards the end of the month.
summary: A visualization of all the coffee I drank in October, 2019.
title: October in Coffee

content:
I drew these patterns in Illustrator using a Wacom tablet. This was a really fun blend of doodling and digital art!
I was inspired by dark, earthtone paisleys I saw on clothing growing up for my first pattern.
I reused some of the same elements in my second pattern, and tried to incorporate each of the plants I have in my bedroom right now!
summary: Recently, I learned to create tossed patterns using Adobe Illustrator.
title: Tossed Patterns

summary: A robust Shiny app developed to explore the National Gallery of Art's collection data.
title: Intent in Acquisition
